intro: Draba jonocalyx, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows at high elevations. Draba jonocalyx is adapted to cold climates and is typically in bloom during the short growing season of summer.
